Package de.ad.sharp.api

SharP wraps your SharedPreferences into a clean, type-safe Java interface.

See: Description

  • Class Summary

  • Annotation Types Summary 
    Annotation Type Description
    SharedPreference
    Annotates an interface to auto-generate its implementation using Sharp's annotation processor.

Package de.ad.sharp.api Description

SharP wraps your SharedPreferences into a clean, type-safe Java interface. It uses annotation processing to generate the boilerplate code for you.

Just define an interface and annotate it to be a @SharedPreference: 


    @SharedPreference
   interface LocalStorage{
     String getMyStringPreference();
     void setMyStringPreference(String value);
     int getMyIntPreference();
     void setMyIntPreference(int value);
   }
Use SharP to instantiate the auto-generated implementation: 

   LocalStorage storage = SharP.getInstance(context, LocalStorage.class);
